response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (21 years)", "medium", "Young age is associated with a higher risk of recidivism, though it is not the sole determining factor."],
    ["Race (Black)", "medium", "Statistically, certain groups have been shown to be at moderate risk in various studies; however, caution is needed to ensure this is not used in a discriminatory manner."],
    ["Criminal history (7 arrests and convictions)", "high", "A significant number of prior arrests and convictions strongly correlate with a higher risk of recidivism."],
    ["Physical characteristics (5 feet 7 inches, 142 lbs)", "low", "There is no direct link between physical stature and recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital status and living arrangement (never married, living alone)", "medium", "Social isolation factors such as living alone can contribute moderately to recidivism risk."],
    ["Education (High school diploma, not in college)", "medium", "Limited educational attainment is moderately associated with recidivism, potentially reflecting fewer opportunities for socio-economic advancement."],
    ["Employment (Held 2 jobs during the year)", "medium", "Limited job stability and fewer employment experiences can be a moderate risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Substance use (Marijuana use in past four years)", "medium", "Recent substance use, even if limited to marijuana, is moderately associated with recidivism risk."],
    ["Mental health (Not depressed)", "low", "Absence of depressive symptoms is a protective factor, lowering immediate mental health-related recidivism risk."],
    ["Early family environment (Lived with biological mother in a household of 5 in an urban area)", "medium", "An urban upbringing in a larger household can be associated with mixed support and challenges, moderately affecting risk."],
    ["Religious belief (Thinks God has something to do with personal events)", "low", "A belief in God can serve as a protective factor, reducing stress and potentially lowering recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with a higher risk of recidivism, though it is not the sole determining factor.
Statistically, certain groups have been shown to be at moderate risk in various studies; however, caution is needed to ensure this is not used in a discriminatory manner.
A significant number of prior arrests and convictions strongly correlate with a higher risk of recidivism.
There is no direct link between physical stature and recidivism risk.
Marital status and living arrangement (never married, living alone)
Social isolation factors such as living alone can contribute moderately to recidivism risk.
Education (High school diploma, not in college)
Limited educational attainment is moderately associated with recidivism, potentially reflecting fewer opportunities for socio-economic advancement.
Limited job stability and fewer employment experiences can be a moderate risk factor for recidivism.
Substance use (Marijuana use in past four years)
Recent substance use, even if limited to marijuana, is moderately associated with recidivism risk.
Absence of depressive symptoms is a protective factor, lowering immediate mental health-related recidivism risk.
Early family environment (Lived with biological mother in a household of 5 in an urban area)
An urban upbringing in a larger household can be associated with mixed support and challenges, moderately affecting risk.
Religious belief (Thinks God has something to do with personal events)
A belief in God can serve as a protective factor, reducing stress and potentially lowering recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 7 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 7 inches and weighs 142 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
